author.bio:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!
author.bio_html:

body:
On reddit, if you hover your mouse over a timestamp, the title text will show something like this: "Fri Jun 5 20:48:40 2020 UTC".

Currently, for posts and account creation dates, it looks like it will display the date, but not the time of day. For comments, edit times, and guild creation dates, there is no tooltip at all.
body_html:

guild.description:
This used to be a place to share, view, and track feedback for Ruqqus. Now it's pretty useless because the admins don't care. Try buttering them up on discord. They don't respond here. 

+ruqqusbugs

This used to be a place to share, view, and track feedback for Ruqqus. Now it's pretty useless because the admins don't care. Try buttering them up on discord. They don't respond here.

+RuqqusBugs
guild.name: BetaFeedback

title: Suggestion: display exact time when hovering over timestamps

body: There are security reasons to not show exact timestamps. This aids in keeping us anonymous here.
body_html: There are security reasons to not show exact timestamps. This aids in keeping us anonymous here.

post.body_html:
On reddit, if you hover your mouse over a timestamp, the title text will show something like this: "Fri Jun 5 20:48:40 2020 UTC".

Currently, for posts and account creation dates, it looks like it will display the date, but not the time of day. For comments, edit times, and guild creation dates, there is no tooltip at all.
post.title: Suggestion: display exact time when hovering over timestamps

body: How can the exact timestamp de-anonymize a user? By allowing to analyze their activity and approximate their geographical location?
body_html: How can the exact timestamp de-anonymize a user? By allowing to analyze their activity and approximate their geographical location?
